p:
We can also adjust these prior results based on the assumption that asymptomatic index cases occur in the same proportion as in our surveillance bias scenario, but they escape surveillance. The adjusted 95% confidence intervals for Breban et al.’s model are 0.25–0.54 for R
i and 0.30–0.87 for R overall. The adjusted 95% confidence intervals for Cauchemez et al.’s model are 0.39–0.88 for R
i and 0.34–0.77 for R overall. These adjusted values are best compared to our surveillance bias results.
